description: silicon +â€Ž -one. Originally obtained by the attempted synthesis of the silicon equivalent of a ketone.

entries.meaning: (chemistry) Any of a class of inert, semi-inorganic polymeric compounds (polysiloxanes), that have a wide range of thermal stability and extreme water repellence, used in a very wide range of industrial applications, and in prosthetic replacements for body parts.

verbs.description: silicone (third-person singular simple present silicones, present participle siliconing, simple past and past participle siliconed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To join or treat (something) with a silicone-based product.
examples: silicone the bathtub to the tile

entries.meaning: (informal, transitive) To enhance or reconstruct (a body part) with a prosthesis containing silicone.
